meanings.definition: The pointed head or striking tip of a spear.
meanings.sent1: The warrior aimed the spearhead at the target.
meanings.sent2: The metal spearhead gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped on a toy spearhead, ouch!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a sharp spearhead, cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The spearhead was finely crafted, designed for maximum impact.

meanings.definition: To lead or initiate an attack or movement.
meanings.sent1: The general decided to spearhead the assault on the enemy.
meanings.sent2: She will spearhead the project to ensure its success.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to spearhead a mission to steal treats from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: His innovative ideas spearhead a new era of technology.
meanings.sent5: The team chose her to spearhead the fundraising campaign due to her leadership skills.

meanings.definition: A person or group that leads or initiates an attack or movement.
meanings.sent1: The brave soldier was the spearhead of the battalion.
meanings.sent2: The environmental activists acted as the spearhead for change.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel became the spearhead of the nut-stealing operation.
meanings.sent4: Their organization served as the spearhead in advocating for equal rights.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur became the spearhead of a successful startup company.
